idea-plugin.name: C/C++ New Single Entry Point
idea-plugin.description:
If you are from Java world, you might be used to simply creating a new single public static void main in order to create a new entry point for testing purpose. With CMake things are more complicating since all files needed to be linked together and duplicated method names will not be tolerated, thereforeCMakeLists.txt needs to be configured to declare add_execsinglefileexecutionactionutable(Example example.c) to run a new entry point. It is troublesome when you want to run many of the files independently within the same project.
This plugin supports to insert add_executable() statement into CMakeLists.txt. It will try to find the nearest CMakeLists.txt on the same folder level with the targeted source code. If it doesn't exist, the root CMakeLists.txt will be token.
